monster.name: Advanced Detention Drone
monster.languages: understands commands given in any language but can't speak
monster.description: Source: The Book of Many Things p. 135

trait.name: Bound
trait.text: The drone is magically bound to an amulet. As long as the guardian and its amulet are on the same plane of existence, the amulet's wearer can telepathically call the guardian to travel to it, and the guardian knows the distance and direction to the amulet. If the guardian is within 60 feet of the amulet's wearer, half of any damage the wearer takes (rounded up) is transferred to the guardian.

trait.name: Regeneration
trait.text: The drone regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point.

trait.name: Spell Storing
trait.text: A spellcaster who wears the drone's amulet can cause the guardian to store one spell of 4th level or lower. To do so, the wearer must cast the spell on the guardian. The spell has no effect but is stored within the guardian. When commanded to do so by the wearer or when a situation arises that was predefined by the spellcaster, the guardian casts the stored spell with any parameters set by the original caster, requiring no components. When the spell is cast or a new spell is stored, any previously stored spell is lost.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The guardian makes two fist attacks.

action.name: Fist
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Detention Orb
action.text: The drone launches a tiny orb of magical force at a creature it can see within 30 feet of itself. The creature must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or be encased in the orb, which expands to a size just large enough to contain the creature. While encased, the creature doesn't need to breathe, eat, or drink, and it doesn't age. Nothing can pass through the orb, nor can any creature teleport or use planar travel to enter or exit the orb. As a bonus action, the drone can move the orb and its contents up to 30 feet in any direction. A successful casting of the Dispel Magic spell on the orb (DC 15) destroys it. The orb otherwise remains intact until the drone spends an action to end the effect or the drone is destroyed. A drone can have only one detention orb active at a time; if the drone creates a detention orb when it already has one active, the first orb disappears, freeing the creature inside.

reaction.name: Shield
reaction.text: When a creature makes an attack against the wearer of the guardian's amulet, the guardian grants a +2 bonus to the wearer's AC if the guardian is within 5 feet of the wearer.

monster.name: Ambitious Assassin
monster.languages: Common, thieves' cant, plus any one language
monster.description: Source: The Book of Many Things p. 45

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (2/Day)
trait.text: If the assassin fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The assassin makes two Poison Blade attacks.

action.name: Poison Blade
action.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 60 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d4 + 4) piercing damage plus 5 (1d10) poison damage.

reaction.name: Uncanny Dodge
reaction.text: When an attacker the assassin can see hits the assassin with an attack, the assassin halves the attack's damage against it.

legendary.name: Legendary Actions (3/Turn)
legendary.text: The Ambitious Assassin can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The Ambitious Assassin regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary.name: Cunning
legendary.text: The assassin escapes nonmagical restraints and ends the grappled condition on itself, then moves up to its speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

legendary.name: Stab (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary.text: The assassin makes one Poison Blade attack.

legendary.name: Vanishing Escape (Costs 3 Actions)
legendary.text: The assassin creates a sudden distraction, such as a cloud of disorienting smoke or flash of dazzling light, filling a 10-foot cube within 5 feet of the assassin. Each creature of the assassin's choice in that area takes 9 (2d8) psychic damage, and the assassin has the invisible condition. This invisibility lasts until the end of the assassin's next turn.

monster.name: Animated Armor Detention Drone
monster.conditionImmune: blinded, charmed, deafened, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned
monster.description: Source: The Book of Many Things p. 135

trait.name: Antimagic Susceptibility
trait.text: The drone is incapacitated while in the area of an antimagic field. If targeted by dispel magic, the drone must succeed on a Constitution saving throw against the caster's spell save DC or fall unconscious for 1 minute.

trait.name: False Appearance
trait.text: While the drone remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a normal suit of drone.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The drone makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Slam
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Detention Orb
action.text: The drone launches a tiny orb of magical force at a creature it can see within 30 feet of itself. The creature must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or be encased in the orb, which expands to a size just large enough to contain the creature. While encased, the creature doesn't need to breathe, eat, or drink, and it doesn't age. Nothing can pass through the orb, nor can any creature teleport or use planar travel to enter or exit the orb. As a bonus action, the drone can move the orb and its contents up to 30 feet in any direction. A successful casting of the Dispel Magic spell on the orb (DC 15) destroys it. The orb otherwise remains intact until the drone spends an action to end the effect or the drone is destroyed. A drone can have only one detention orb active at a time; if the drone creates a detention orb when it already has one active, the first orb disappears, freeing the creature inside.

monster.name: Aspirant of the Comet
monster.description: Source: The Book of Many Things p. 91

trait.name: Hunger of the Void
trait.text: When the aspirant is reduced to 0 hit points, its body and everything it is wearing or carrying, except for magic items, are sucked into a void and destroyed. Creatures in a 15-foot-radius sphere centered on the aspirant must make a DC 11 Strength saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 10 (3d6) necrotic damage and is pulled 10 feet straight toward the aspirant's space. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage only.

trait.name: Sinister Devotion
trait.text: The aspirant has advantage on saving throws against the charmed and frightened conditions.

action.name: Spear
action.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d6 + 1) piercing damage, or 5 (1d8 + 1) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

monster.name: Asteria
monster.skill: persuasion +11, survival +6, arcana +14, investigation +8, acrobatics +11, perception +12
monster.description: Source: The Book of Many Things p. 188

trait.name: Special Equipment
trait.text: Asteria wears Winged Boots, which grant her a flying speed (included in her statistics). She also carries one half of a pair of Sending Stones; the other half of the pair is held by Euryale.

trait.name: Guardian Aura
trait.text: Whenever a creature of Asteria's choice within 30 feet of her makes a saving throw, Asteria can give the creature advantage on the saving throw (no action required). This trait doesn't function if Asteria has the incapacitated condition.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
trait.text: If Asteria fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: Asteria makes two Radiant Blade attacks and uses Bursting Benediction.

action.name: Radiant Blade
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (1d8 + 5) slashing damage plus 13 (3d8) radiant damage.

action.name: Bursting Benediction
action.text: Asteria causes a burst of magical energy to envelop one creature she can see within 60 feet of herself. The target must make a DC 19 Dexterity saving throw, taking 40 (9d8) force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Asteria or another creature that she can see within 60 feet of herself then regains 10 hit points.

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text:
Asteria casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 19):
• At will: Guidance, Light, Thaumaturgy • 2/Day each: Bless, Freedom of Movement, Greater Restoration, Plane Shift (self only), Protection from Evil and Good, Revivify

action.name: Empowering Aegis (Recharge 4-6) (Bonus Action)
action.text: Asteria summons a spectral version of her shield, which orbits and bolsters one creature of Asteria's choice that she can see within 60 feet of herself. The spectral shield lasts until the start of Asteria's next turn. While the shield is orbiting the creature, the creature has half cover, is immune to the frightened condition, and makes weapon attack rolls with advantage.

legendary.name: Legendary Actions (3/Turn)
legendary.text: Asteria can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. Asteria regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary.name: Brazen Strike
legendary.text: Asteria makes one Radiant Blade attack.

legendary.name: Nimble Sprint
legendary.text: Asteria moves up to her speed. This movement doesn't provoke opportunity attacks.

legendary.name: Cast a Spell (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary.text: Asteria uses Spellcasting.

monster.spells: guidance, light, thaumaturgy, bless, freedom of movement, greater restoration, plane shift, protection from evil and good, revivify

monster.name: Aurnozci
monster.immune: acid, fire, poison; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks
monster.description: Source: The Book of Many Things p. 167

trait.name: Heat Regeneration
trait.text: If the temperature around it is 100 degrees Fahrenheit or higher, Aurnozci regains 15 hit points at the start of its turn. If it takes cold or radiant damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of its next turn. Aurnozci dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
trait.text: If Aurnozci fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: Aurnozci has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: Aurnozci makes one Bite attack and two Tail attacks.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +15 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 21 (2d12 + 8) slashing damage plus 9 (2d8) fire damage.

action.name: Tail
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +15 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 17 (2d8 + 8) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Mucus Spray (Recharge 5-6)
action.text: Aurnozci sprays mucus in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that cone must make a DC 20 Dexterity saving throw, taking 42 (12d6) acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text:
Aurnozci casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 20):
• At will: Detect Magic, Heat Metal (7th-level version) • 2/Day each: Darkness, Dispel Magic, Hold Person

legendary.name: Legendary Actions (3/Turn)
legendary.text: Aurnozci can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. Aurnozci regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary.name: Move
legendary.text: Aurnozci moves up to its speed.

legendary.name: Tail
legendary.text: Aurnozci makes one Tail attack.

legendary.name: Cast a Spell (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary.text: Aurnozci uses Spellcasting.

legendary.name: Conflagration (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary.text: Flames momentarily surround Aurnozci. Each creature within 15 feet of Aurnozci must make a DC 20 Dexterity saving throw, taking 18 (4d8) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

monster.spells: detect magic, heat metal, darkness, dispel magic, hold person

monster.name: Boss Augustus
monster.languages: Common, Thieves' cant (can't speak in wolf form)
monster.description: Source: The Book of Many Things p. 82

trait.name: Special Equipment
trait.text: Augustus wields a +2 Longsword.

trait.name: Regeneration
trait.text: Augustus regains 10 hit points at the start of his turn. If he takes damage from a silver weapon, this trait doesn't function at the start of his next turn. Augustus dies only if he starts his turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: Augustus makes any combination of two Bite, Claw, or Magic Longsword attacks.

action.name: Bite (Wolf or Hybrid Form Only)
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 26 (5d8 + 4) piercing damage. If the target is a Humanoid, it must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or be cursed with lycanthropy. While cursed in this way, the target retains its alignment, languages, and equipment but otherwise uses the werewolf stat block, excluding actions that require equipment the target doesn't have. During any night when there's a full moon in the sky, the target becomes an NPC under the DM's control and remains so until the night ends. A Remove Curse spell or similar magic ends this curse.

action.name: Claw (Wolf or Hybrid Form Only)
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 21 (5d6 + 4) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 16 Strength saving throw or have the prone condition.

action.name: Magic Longsword (Humanoid or Hybrid Form Only)
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 28 (4d10 + 6) slashing damage.

action.name: Change Shape (Bonus Action)
action.text: Augustus polymorphs into a wolf-humanoid hybrid, a wolf, or his humanoid form. His statistics, other than his speed, are the same in each form. Any equipment he is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. He reverts to his humanoid form if he dies.

action.name: Cunning Action (Bonus Action)
action.text: Augustus takes the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action.

monster.name: Boss Delour
monster.skill: deception +11, stealth +8, sleight of hand +8, perception +10
monster.languages: Common, Thieves' cant (can't speak in rat form)
monster.description: Source: The Book of Many Things p. 83

trait.name: Evasion
trait.text: If Delour is subjected to an effect that allows him to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, he instead takes no damage if he succeeds on the saving throw and only half damage if he fails, provided he doesn't have the incapacitated condition.

trait.name: Nimbleness
trait.text: Delour can move through the space of a Medium or larger creature.

trait.name: Regeneration
trait.text: Delour regains 10 hit points at the start of his turn. If he takes damage from a silver weapon, this trait doesn't function at the start of his next turn. Delour dies only if he starts his turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: Delour makes any combination of three Bite, Shortsword, or Hand Crossbow attacks.

action.name: Bite (Rat or Hybrid Form Only)
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 26 (5d8 + 4) piercing damage. If the target is a Humanoid, it must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or be cursed with lycanthropy. While cursed in this way, the target retains its alignment, languages, and equipment but otherwise uses the wererat stat block, excluding actions that require equipment the target doesn't have. During any night when there's a full moon in the sky, the target becomes an NPC under the DM's control and remains so until the night ends. A Remove Curse spell or similar magic ends this curse.

action.name: Shortsword (Humanoid or Hybrid Form Only)
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) poison damage.

action.name: Hand Crossbow (Humanoid or Hybrid Form Only)
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) poison damage.

action.name: Change Shape (Bonus Action)
action.text: Delour polymorphs into a rat-humanoid hybrid, a Medium giant rat, or his humanoid form. His statistics, other than his size and speed, are the same in each form. Any equipment he is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. He reverts to his humanoid form if he dies.

action.name: Cunning Action (Bonus Action)
action.text: Delour takes the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action.

monster.name: Breath Drinker
monster.resist: acid, cold, fire, lightning, thunder; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks
monster.conditionImmune: grappled, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, restrained
monster.description: Source: The Book of Many Things p. 154

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
trait.text: The breath drinker can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Radiant Absorption
trait.text: When the breath drinker is subjected to radiant damage, it takes no damage and instead regains a number of hit points equal to the radiant damage dealt.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The breath drinker makes two Enervating Claw attacks. It can also use Drink Breath.

action.name: Enervating Claw
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 12 (2d6 + 5) necrotic damage, and if the target is Large or smaller, it has the grappled condition (escape DC 18). The target must succeed on a DC 18 Constitution saving throw or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

action.name: Drink Breath
action.text: The breath drinker targets a creature that has the incapacitated condition or that the breath drinker is grappling and that isn't a Construct or an Undead. The target must make a DC 18 Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 36 (8d8) necrotic damage, and its Charisma score is reduced by 1d6. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a short or long rest. If this reduces the target's Charisma to 0, the target dies. Until the breath drinker dies, the dead target can't be returned to life by any means short of divine intervention. On a successful save, the target takes half as much necrotic damage only. On a successful or failed save, the breath drinker regains a number of hit points equal to the necrotic damage dealt.

action.name: Invisibility
action.text: The breath drinker has the invisible condition. This invisibility ends immediately after the breath drinker hits or misses with an attack roll or uses Drink Breath.

monster.name: Brusipha
monster.description: Source: The Book of Many Things p. 127

trait.name: Demonic Ritual
trait.text: Brusipha can spend 3 hours performing a ritual that summons 1d3 + 1 barlguras or 1 hezrou. She must sacrifice a Medium or larger living creature to Baphomet during this ritual, and the ritual can be performed only at night. The demons vanish at dawn.

trait.name: Labyrinthine Recall
trait.text: Brusipha can perfectly recall any path she has traveled.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: Brusipha makes two Eldritch Blast attacks.

action.name: Eldritch Blast
action.text: Ranged Spell Attack: +5 to hit, range 120 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d10 + 3) force damage.

action.name: Gore
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) piercing damage plus 4 (1d8) necrotic damage. If Brusipha moved at least 10 feet straight toward the target immediately before she hit, the target takes an extra 4 (1d8) piercing damage, and if the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 15 Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 10 feet from Brusipha and have the prone condition.

action.name: Incite the Hunters (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
action.text: Brusipha allows each ally within 30 feet of herself that has the Unerring Tracker trait to make one weapon attack as a reaction against the target of that ally's Unerring Tracker.

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text:
Brusipha casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 13):
• At will: Prestidigitation, Speak with Animals • 1/Day each: Bestow Curse, Command, Crown of Madness

action.name: Unerring Tracker (Bonus Action)
action.text: Brusipha magically creates a psychic link with one creature she can see. For the next hour, Brusipha knows the current distance and direction to the target if it is on the same plane of existence. The link ends if Brusipha has the incapacitated condition or uses this ability on a different target.

reaction.name: Baphomet's Blessing
reaction.text: When Brusipha reduces a hostile creature to 0 hit points, she gains 8 temporary hit points.

monster.spells: prestidigitation, speak with animals, bestow curse, command, crown of madness

monster.name: Deck Defender
monster.conditionImmune: blinded, charmed, deafened, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned
monster.senses: blindsight 60 ft. (can't see beyond this radius)
monster.languages: understands one of your languages but can't speak
monster.description: Source: The Book of Many Things p. 72

trait.name: Proficiency Bonus
trait.text: equals your bonus

trait.name: HP
trait.text: 5 + five times your level (the deck defender has a number of Hit Dice [d8s] equal to your level)

trait.name: Allied Knight
trait.text: Some of the deck defender's statistics are based on the character who drew the Knight card. Where the deck defender stat block refers to "you," it refers to that character.

trait.name: Folded Versatility
trait.text: After finishing a long rest, you can refold the deck defender's shape, changing it to acrobat form, berserker form, or guardian form.

trait.name: Fragile
trait.text: If the deck defender is reduced to 0 hit points, it collapses into a haphazard pile of nonmagical playing cards and can't be resurrected or reconstructed.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The deck defender makes a number of attacks equal to half its proficiency bonus (rounded down).

action.name: Paper Cut
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: PB + +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) slashing damage.

action.name: Reckless Strike (Berserker Form Only)
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: PB + +3 to hit (with advantage), reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) slashing damage, and attacks made against the deck defender until the start of its next turn have advantage.

action.name: Swift Step (Acrobat Form Only) (Bonus Action)
action.text: The deck defender takes the Dash or Disengage action.

reaction.name: Protection (Guardian Form Only)
reaction.text: When a creature the deck defender can see attacks a target other than the deck defender and is within 5 feet of the deck defender, the deck defender imposes disadvantage on the attack roll.

monster.name: Enchanting Infiltrator
monster.languages: Common, thieves' cant, plus any one language
monster.description: Source: The Book of Many Things p. 46

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
trait.text: If the infiltrator fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Veiled Presence
trait.text: The infiltrator's AC includes its Wisdom modifier, and the infiltrator can't be targeted by divination magic or features that would read its mind or determine its creature type.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The infiltrator makes two Poison Blade attacks and can use Beguiling Whisper.

action.name: Poison Blade
action.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 60 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d4 + 5) piercing damage plus 11 (2d10) poison damage.

action.name: Beguiling Whisper
action.text: The infiltrator magically whispers to a creature it can see within 30 feet of itself. The target must succeed on a DC 17 Wisdom saving throw or have the stunned condition due to fear or delight (the infiltrator's choice) until the end of the target's next turn, after which the target is immune to this Beguiling Whisper for 24 hours.

reaction.name: Uncanny Dodge
reaction.text: When an attacker the infiltrator can see hits the infiltrator with an attack, the infiltrator halves the attack's damage against it.

legendary.name: Legendary Actions (3/Turn)
legendary.text: The Enchanting Infiltrator can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The Enchanting Infiltrator regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary.name: Cunning
legendary.text: The infiltrator escapes nonmagical restraints and ends the grappled condition on itself, then moves up to its speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

legendary.name: Stab (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary.text: The infiltrator makes one Poison Blade attack.

legendary.name: Misdirecting Escape (Costs 3 Actions)
legendary.text: The infiltrator magically has the invisible condition and creates an illusory duplicate of itself in its space, then teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, to an unoccupied space within 15 feet of itself. The image flings illusory blades at two creatures of the infiltrator's choice within 20 feet of the image. Each target must make a DC 17 Wisdom saving throw, taking 13 (3d8) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The invisibility lasts until the end of the infiltrator's next turn.

monster.name: Euryale
monster.speed: 30 ft., 50 ft. in serpent form, climb 50 ft. in serpent form
monster.skill: insight +17, nature +13, animal handling +11, medicine +11, perception +11
monster.resist: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks
monster.description: Source: The Book of Many Things p. 189

trait.name: Special Equipment
trait.text: Euryale carries one half of a pair of Sending Stones; the other half of the pair is held by Asteria.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
trait.text: If Euryale fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: Euryale makes three attacks. If she is in serpent form, only one of these attacks can be Constrict.

action.name: Constrict (Serpent Form Only)
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 15 ft., one Large or smaller creature. Hit: 16 (2d10 + 5) bludgeoning damage, and the target has the grappled condition (escape DC 19). action.name: Snake Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 12 (2d6 + 5) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 18 Constitution saving throw or have the poisoned condition until the start of Euryale's next turn.

action.name: Verdant Bolt (Medusa Form Only)
action.text: Ranged Spell Attack: +11 to hit, range 120 ft., one target. Hit: 18 (4d8) acid damage.

action.name: Spellcasting (Medusa Form Only)
action.text:
Euryale casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 19):
• At will: Druidcraft, Pass without Trace • 2/Day each: Goodberry, Lesser Restoration, Locate Creature, Move Earth, Transport via Plants

action.name: Change Shape (Bonus Action)
action.text: Euryale changes shape into her Huge serpent form or back into her Medium medusa form. Euryale's game statistics are the same in each form except where noted in this stat block. Any equipment she is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. Euryale reverts to her medusa form if she dies.

action.name: Petrifying Gaze (Recharge 4-6) (Bonus Action)
action.text:
Euryale unleashes petrifying magic from her eyes in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 18 Constitution saving throw if it doesn't have the blinded condition. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the creature has the petrified condition. Otherwise, on a failed save, the creature takes 14 (4d6) force damage, begins to turn to stone, and has the restrained condition. The restrained creature must repeat the saving throw at the end of its next turn. On a failed save, it has the petrified condition, and on a successful save, the effect ends on it, The petrification lasts until the creature is freed by the Greater Restoration spell or other magic A creature can use its reaction, if available, to shut its eyes to avoid the saving throw. If the creature does so, it has the blinded condition until the end of its next turn.

monster.name: Malaxxix
monster.resist: cold, fire, lightning; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks
monster.description: Source: The Book of Many Things p. 173

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
trait.text: If Malaxxix fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: Malaxxix has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: Malaxxix makes two Forge Hammer or Whip attacks in any combination.

action.name: Forge Hammer
action.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, reach 10 ft. or range 60/180 ft., one target. Hit: 28 (4d10 + 6) bludgeoning damage, and the target can't take reactions until the end of Malaxxix's next turn. Hit or Miss: The hammer then magically returns to Malaxxix's hand.

action.name: Whip
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, reach 30 ft., one creature. Hit: 15 (2d8 + 6) slashing damage, and the target has the restrained condition for 1 minute. The restrained target can make a DC 20 Strength saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. Only one creature can be restrained by the whip at a time.

action.name: Mezzoloth Vortex (Recharge 5-6)
action.text: Malaxxix summons a vortex of whirling mezzoloths at a point it can see within 90 feet of itself. The vortex is a 30-foot-radius, 100-foot-high cylinder centered on that point. Each creature other than Malaxxix in that area must make a DC 20 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 35 (10d6) force damage and has the restrained condition while within the cylinder. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and is pushed to the nearest unoccupied space outside the cylinder. The vortex lasts until the start of Malaxxix's next turn.

legendary.name: Legendary Actions (3/Turn)
legendary.text: Malaxxix can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. Malaxxix regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary.name: Fiendish Stride
legendary.text: Malaxxix moves up to its speed. This movement doesn't provoke opportunity attacks. When Malaxxix moves within 5 feet of a creature during this movement, that creature takes 5 (1d10) lightning damage. A creature can take this damage only once per turn.

legendary.name: Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary.text: Malaxxix makes one Forge Hammer or Whip attack.

monster.name: Minotaur Archaeologist
monster.description: Source: The Book of Many Things p. 126

trait.name: Labyrinthine Recall
trait.text: The minotaur can perfectly recall any path it has traveled.

action.name: Gore
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d6 + 1) piercing damage. If the minotaur moved at least 10 feet straight toward the target immediately before it hit, the target takes an extra 3 (1d6) piercing damage, and if the target is a Large or smaller creature, it must succeed on a DC 11 Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 10 feet from the minotaur and have the prone condition.

monster.name: Minotaur Infiltrator
monster.description: Source: The Book of Many Things p. 127

trait.name: Labyrinthine Recall
trait.text: The minotaur can perfectly recall any path it has traveled.

action.name: Gore
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) piercing damage, or 13 (2d8 + 4) piercing damage while enlarged. If the minotaur moved at least 10 feet straight toward the target immediately before it hit, the target takes an extra 4 (1d8) piercing damage, or 9 (2d8) piercing damage if the minotaur is enlarged. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 14 Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 10 feet from the minotaur and have the prone condition.

action.name: Mattock
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (1d12 + 4) bludgeoning damage, or 17 (2d12 + 4) bludgeoning damage while enlarged. If the target is a creature and the minotaur is enlarged, the target must succeed on a DC 14 Strength saving throw or have the prone condition.

action.name: Enlarge (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
action.text: For 1 minute, the minotaur magically increases in size, along with anything it is wearing or carrying. While enlarged, the minotaur is Large, doubles its damage dice on Strength-based weapon attacks (included in the attacks), and makes Strength checks and Strength saving throws with advantage. If the minotaur lacks the room to become Large, the minotaur doesn't change size.

action.name: Unerring Tracker (Bonus Action)
action.text: The minotaur magically creates a psychic link with one creature it can see. For the next hour, the minotaur knows the current distance and direction to the target if it is on the same plane of existence. The link ends if the minotaur has the incapacitated condition or uses this ability on a different target.

monster.name: Oddlewin
monster.description: Source: The Book of Many Things p. 111

trait.name: Fortune Teller
trait.text: Oddlewin can cast the Augury spell as a ritual, using cards as the material component.

trait.name: Nilbogism
trait.text:
Any creature that attempts to damage Oddlewin must first succeed on a DC 12 Charisma saving throw or have the charmed condition until the end of the creature's next turn. The creature must use its action praising Oddlewin.
Oddlewin can't regain hit points, including through magical healing, except through his Reversal of Fortune reaction.

action.name: Fool's Scepter
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Cloud of Cards
action.text: Oddlewin conjures magical cards that slash at the air in a 5-foot cube within 60 feet of Oddlewin until the start of Oddlewin's next turn. A creature that starts its turn in the cube or that enters that area for the first time on a turn takes 10 (4d4) slashing damage.

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text:
Oddlewin casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 12):
• At will: Mage Hand, Tasha's Hideous Laughter

action.name: Nimble Escape (Bonus Action)
action.text: Oddlewin takes the Disengage or Hide action.

reaction.name: Reversal of Fortune
reaction.text: In response to another creature dealing damage to Oddlewin, Oddlewin reduces the damage to 0 and regains 9 (2d8) hit points.

monster.name: Otherworldly Corrupter
monster.description: Source: The Book of Many Things p. 47

trait.name: Alien Mind
trait.text: Magic and other features can't determine the corrupter's creature type. If a creature tries to read the corrupter's thoughts, that creature must succeed on a DC 20 Intelligence saving throw or have the stunned condition for 1 minute. The stunned creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
trait.text: If the corrupter fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Spider Climb
trait.text: The corrupter can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The corrupter makes three Whispering Blade attacks and can use Debilitating Touch.

action.name: Whispering Blade
action.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 60 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (1d8 + 6) piercing damage plus 14 (4d6) psychic damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 20 Wisdom saving throw or be unable to speak until the start of the corrupter's next turn.

action.name: Debilitating Touch
action.text: The corrupter's squirming tentacle lashes out at a creature the corrupter can see within 30 feet of itself. The target must succeed on a DC 20 Constitution saving throw or have the paralyzed condition until the end of its next turn, after which the target is immune to this Debilitating Touch for 24 hours.

action.name: Change Shape (Bonus Action)
action.text: The corrupter magically transforms into any creature that is Small or Medium, while retaining its game statistics (other than its size). This transformation ends if the corrupter is reduced to 0 hit points or uses a bonus action to end it.

reaction.name: Uncanny Dodge
reaction.text: When an attacker the corrupter can see hits the corrupter with an attack, the corrupter halves the attack's damage against it.

legendary.name: Legendary Actions (3/Turn)
legendary.text: The Otherworldly Corrupter can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The Otherworldly Corrupter regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary.name: Cunning
legendary.text: The corrupter escapes nonmagical restraints and ends the grappled and restrained conditions on itself, then moves up to its speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

legendary.name: Stab (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary.text: The corrupter makes one Whispering Blade attack.

legendary.name: Amorphous Escape (Costs 3 Actions)
legendary.text: The corrupter dissolves into a shifting mass of flesh, tentacles, eyes, claws, and mouths. Up to two creatures the corrupter can see within 20 feet of itself must make a DC 20 Intelligence saving throw, taking 18 (4d8) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. This transformation lasts until the end of the corrupter's next turn. While transformed, the corrupter has advantage on attack rolls, attack rolls made against it have disadvantage, and it can move through spaces at least 1 inch wide without squeezing.

monster.name: Pazrodine
monster.description: Source: The Book of Many Things p. 113

trait.name: Guardian of the Market
trait.text: Pazrodine can sense when an item is stolen from Seelie Market. She knows the distance and direction to stolen items, as if by the Locate Object spell.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
trait.text: If Pazrodine fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: Pazrodine makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +13 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 17 (2d10 + 6) piercing damage plus 11 (2d10) radiant damage.

action.name: Claw
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +13 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d6 + 6) slashing damage.

action.name: Tail
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +13 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (1d8 + 6) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 21 Strength saving throw or have the prone condition.

action.name: Breath Weapon (Recharge 5-6)
action.text:
Pazrodine uses one of the following breath weapons:
Dream Breath: Pazrodine exhales mist in a 90-foot cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a DC 21 Constitution saving throw or have the unconscious condition for 10 minutes. This effect ends for a creature if the creature takes damage or someone uses an action to wake it.
Moonlight Breath: Pazrodine exhales a beam of moonlight in a 120-foot line that is 10 feet wide. Each creature in that area must make a DC 21 Dexterity saving throw, taking 60 (11d10) radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text:
Pazrodine casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 23):
• At will: Faerie Fire • 2/Day each: Calm Emotions, Dispel Magic, Invisibility • 1/Day each: Mass Cure Wounds, Revivify

legendary.name: Legendary Actions (3/Turn)
legendary.text: Pazrodine can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. Pazrodine regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary.name: Tail
legendary.text: Pazrodine makes one Tail attack.

legendary.name: Cast a Spell (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary.text: Pazrodine uses Spellcasting.

monster.spells: faerie fire, calm emotions, dispel magic, invisibility, mass cure wounds, revivify

monster.name: Quadrone Detention Drone
monster.description: Source: The Book of Many Things p. 135

trait.name: Axiomatic Mind
trait.text: The drone can't be compelled to act in a manner contrary to its nature or its instructions.

trait.name: Disintegration
trait.text: If the drone dies, its body disintegrates into dust, leaving behind its weapons and anything else it was carrying.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The drone makes two fist attacks or four shortbow attacks.

action.name: Fist
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 3 (1d4 + 1) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Shortbow
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

action.name: Detention Orb
action.text: The drone launches a tiny orb of magical force at a creature it can see within 30 feet of itself. The creature must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or be encased in the orb, which expands to a size just large enough to contain the creature. While encased, the creature doesn't need to breathe, eat, or drink, and it doesn't age. Nothing can pass through the orb, nor can any creature teleport or use planar travel to enter or exit the orb. As a bonus action, the drone can move the orb and its contents up to 30 feet in any direction. A successful casting of the Dispel Magic spell on the orb (DC 15) destroys it. The orb otherwise remains intact until the drone spends an action to end the effect or the drone is destroyed. A drone can have only one detention orb active at a time; if the drone creates a detention orb when it already has one active, the first orb disappears, freeing the creature inside.

monster.name: Reaper Spirit
monster.description: Source: The Book of Many Things p. 50

trait.name: Proficiency Bonus
trait.text: equals your bonus

trait.name: AC
trait.text: 11 + the level of the spell (natural armor)

trait.name: HP
trait.text: 40 + 10 for each spell level above 4th

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
trait.text: The spirit can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. If it ends its turn inside an object, it is shunted to the nearest unoccupied space and takes 1d10 force damage for every 5 feet shunted.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The spirit makes a number of Reaping Scythe attacks equal to half the level of the spell (rounded down).

action.name: Reaping Scythe
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: your spell attack modifier to hit (with advantage), reach 5 ft., the creature haunted by Haunt Creature. Hit: 1d8 + 3 + summonSpellLevel necrotic damage.

action.name: Haunt Creature (Bonus Action)
action.text: The spirit targets a creature it can see within 10 feet of itself and begins haunting it. While the target is haunted, you and the spirit sense the direction and distance to the target if it is on the same plane of existence as you. Additionally, if the target starts its turn within 10 feet of the spirit, the target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC or have the frightened condition until the start of the target's next turn. The target remains haunted until it dies, the spirit disappears, or the spirit uses this action again.

monster.name: Riffler
monster.skill: insight +5, stealth +6, arcana +6, sleight of hand +9
monster.description: Source: The Book of Many Things p. 181

trait.name: Card Sense
trait.text: The riffler can smell the presence of magical cards, including Decks of Many Things and other magical decks, within 1 mile of itself. It knows the direction to any such cards in that range. Effects that protect a target from divination magic block this sense.

trait.name: Riffling Step
trait.text: The riffler can burrow through any nonmagical material that isn't iron, shuffling the substance through which the riffler moves aside like cards to form a tunnel that closes behind the riffler.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The riffler makes two Spectral Card attacks.

action.name: Spectral Card
action.text: Melee or Ranged Spell Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 60 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d10 + 3) force damage plus 5 (1d10) damage that is radiant if the d10 roll is an even number and necrotic if it's odd.

action.name: Card Spray (Recharge 5-6)
action.text: The riffler magically unleashes a spray of spectral cards in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 14 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 27 (5d10) force damage and has the restrained condition for 1 minute as cards bind it. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage only. A restrained creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Plane Shift
action.text: The riffler casts the Plane Shift spell targeting only itself, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability.

reaction.name: Shuffle Destiny
reaction.text: When a creature the riffler can see within 30 feet of itself makes an ability check, an attack roll, or a saving throw, the riffler can magically force that creature to roll a d6 and either add the number rolled to the total or subtract it from the total (riffler's choice), potentially changing the outcome.

monster.name: Ruin Spider
monster.description: Source: The Book of Many Things p. 182

trait.name: Ruinous Acid
trait.text: Any nonmagical weapon that hits the spider corrodes. After dealing damage, the weapon takes a permanent and cumulative -1 penalty to damage rolls. If its penalty drops to -5, the weapon is destroyed. Nonmagical ammunition made of metal that hits the spider is destroyed after dealing damage.

trait.name: Spider Climb
trait.text: The spider can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Web Sense
trait.text: While in contact with a web, the spider knows the exact location of any other creature in contact with the same web.

trait.name: Web Walker
trait.text: The spider ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The spider makes two Ruinous Bite attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of Web.

action.name: Ruinous Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) piercing damage and 9 (2d8) acid damage. In addition, if the target is a creature wearing nonmagical armor, the armor takes a permanent and cumulative -1 penalty to the AC it offers. Armor reduced to an Armor Class of 10 is destroyed.

action.name: Web (Recharge 5-6)
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, range 30/60 ft., one creature. Hit: The target has the restrained condition. As an action, a restrained target can make a DC 13 Strength check, bursting the webbing on a successful check. The webbing can also be destroyed (AC 10; 5 hit points; vulnerability to fire damage; immunity to acid, bludgeoning, poison, and psychic damage).

monster.name: Sir Jared
monster.description: Source: The Book of Many Things p. 80

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: Jared makes three Longsword attacks.

action.name: Longsword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) slashing damage plus 4 (1d8) radiant damage. On a roll of 19 or 20, Jared scores a critical hit.

reaction.name: Protect Ally
reaction.text: When a creature Jared can see attacks a target other than Jared that is within 5 feet of him, Jared imposes disadvantage on the attack roll.

monster.name: Solar Bastion Knight
monster.description: Source: The Book of Many Things p. 75

trait.name: Aura of Protection
trait.text: The knight and each ally within 10 feet of it have advantage on saving throws. This trait is suppressed while the knight has the incapacitated condition.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The knight makes three Sunspear attacks.

action.name: Sunspear
action.text: Melee or Ranged Spell Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 120 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (3d6 + 4) radiant damage, or 21 (5d6 + 4) radiant damage if the target is a Fiend or an Undead.

action.name: Solar Flare (Recharge 5-6)
action.text:
The knight unleashes a blaze of brilliant energy that fills a 30-foot-radius sphere centered on the knight. Each creature of the knight's choice in that area must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 22 (4d10) radiant damage and has the blinded condition until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage only. For the next minute, the affected area is filled with bright light that is sunlight.
Blinded: • A blinded creature can't see and automatically fails any ability check that requires sight. • Attack rolls against the creature have advantage, and the creature's attack rolls have disadvantage.

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text:
The knight casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 15):
• 1/Day each: Greater Restoration, Sending, Word of Recall (the prepared sanctuary is the Solar Bastion)

monster.spells: greater restoration, sending, word of recall

monster.name: Talon Beast
monster.description: Source: The Book of Many Things p. 183

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The talon beast has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Sense Magic
trait.text: The talon beast can detect and pinpoint the location of magic within 120 feet of itself.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The talon beast makes two Talon attacks or a Talon attack and a Beak attack.

action.name: Beak
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 17 (2d10 + 6) piercing damage, and if the target has any spell effects on itself or any magic items in its possession, the target must make a DC 15 Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, a random spell effect on the target ends. If the target has no spell effects on it, one random magic item in its possession has its magical properties suppressed for 1 minute. If the item is a potion or scroll, it becomes nonmagical instead.

action.name: Talon
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 15 (2d8 + 6) slashing damage, and the target has the grappled condition (escape DC 17). Until the grapple ends, the target has the restrained condition, and the talon beast can't use Talon on another target.

monster.name: Veiled Presence
monster.description: Source: The Book of Many Things p. 48

trait.name: Inviolate Presence
trait.text: The veiled presence can't be targeted by divination magic or by features that would read its mind or determine its creature type.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
trait.text: If the veiled presence fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The veiled presence makes two Blade of Judgment attacks and can use Revelation.

action.name: Blade of Judgment
action.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +14 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 60 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (1d6 + 7) piercing damage plus 27 (6d8) radiant damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 22 Charisma saving throw, or on its next turn, it can either move or take an action, but not both.

action.name: Revelation
action.text: The veiled presence reveals a glimpse of its otherworldly nature to a creature it can see within 30 feet of itself. The target must succeed on a DC 22 Wisdom saving throw or have the paralyzed condition until the end of its next turn, after which the target is immune to this Revelation for 24 hours.

reaction.name: Uncanny Dodge
reaction.text: When an attacker the veiled presence can see hits the veiled presence with an attack, the veiled presence halves the attack's damage against it.

legendary.name: Legendary Actions (3/Turn)
legendary.text: The Veiled Presence can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The Veiled Presence regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary.name: Flash Step
legendary.text: The veiled presence magically teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 40 feet to an unoccupied space that it can see.

legendary.name: Stab (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary.text: The veiled presence makes one Blade of Judgment attack.

legendary.name: Searing Radiance (Costs 3 Actions)
legendary.text: The veiled presence magically emanates dazzling light in a 10-foot-radius sphere centered on itself until the end of its next turn, during which time attack rolls against it have disadvantage and it has advantage on attack rolls. The sphere moves with the veiled presence. When another creature starts its turn in the light or enters the light for the first time on its turn, that creature must make a DC 22 Constitution saving throw, taking 18 (4d8) radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

monster.name: Werevulture
monster.speed: 30 ft., 10 ft. in vulture form, 30 ft. in hybrid form, fly 60 ft. in vulture or hybrid form
monster.description: Source: The Book of Many Things p. 184

trait.name: Regeneration
trait.text: The werevulture regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn. If the werevulture takes radiant damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the werevulture's next turn. The werevulture dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The werevulture makes two Talon attacks, or it makes a Beak attack and a Talon attack.

action.name: Beak (Vulture or Hybrid Form Only)
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) piercing damage. If the target is a Humanoid, it must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or be cursed until targeted by the Remove Curse spell or a similar effect. If the cursed target drops to 0 hit points, it becomes a werevulture under the DM's control and regains 10 hit points.

action.name: Talon
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (4d4 + 3) slashing damage.

action.name: Longbow (Humanoid or Hybrid Form Only)
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d8 + 2) piercing damage.

action.name: Change Shape (Bonus Action)
action.text: The werevulture polymorphs into a vulture-humanoid hybrid, into a vulture, or back into its humanoid form. Its game statistics, other than its speed, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its humanoid form if it dies.
